summary: Email correspondence between Brittany Henderson and an unnamed recipient regarding OVS (Office of Victim Services) applications for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, discussing procedures for victim compensation and therapy sessions. The email chain involves coordination between legal representatives and victim services.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC corresponding about OVS applications for Epstein victims, facilitating victim compensation and therapy arrangements.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the email, presumably a colleague at Edwards Pottinger LLC involved in Epstein victim representation.

persons.name: Randee Kogan
persons.context: Therapist mentioned as the treatment provider for an Epstein victim if the OVS application is approved.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who was discussed with regarding OVS procedures for victims not yet interviewed.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Edwards Pottinger LLC, copied on the same email regarding victim services.
Henderson is arranging for Kogan to provide therapy to an Epstein victim through OVS compensation.

events.title: OVS Application Submission
events.description: Brittany Henderson submits an OVS application for an Epstein victim and discusses therapy arrangements with Randee Kogan.

events.title: Follow-up on Victim Compensation
events.description: Email exchange continues regarding OVS procedures, limitations for New York State crimes, and verification requirements for victims.

locations: 425 North Andrews Ave, Suite 2, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
keyFacts: OVS (Office of Victim Services) compensation is only available for crimes committed in New York State.
Procedures require formal requests for therapy sessions (12 sessions mentioned) through HQ with Randee Kogan.
Victims who have not been interviewed cannot receive a formal police report/FBI crime verification form for OVS claims.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal efforts to secure compensation and therapy for Epstein victims post-conviction.
